course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Hong Kong and the Greater Bay Area
course.description: The Greater Bay Area (GBA) of Guangdong Province is rapidly evolving to be one of the world's largest and most important mega-city regions. Hong Kong has been critical to the GBA's development and the progress of Hong Kong and the region will continue to be intertwined. This course invites students to explore the strengths and weaknesses of individual cities of the GBA and to understand the cultural, economic, political and urban forces that link the cities together and connect the region to the world. Throughout the course we compare the evolution the GBA to other megacity regions in order to better understand the challenges the region faces and to gauge the region's progress.

reviews.author: 科大公道伯
reviews.title: 我要為呢個course平反
reviews.comment_content:
Content 同我想像中有出入 我以為個course係吹奏大灣區但原來並非如此 都有談及一啲發展問題同中國內部問題 感覺其實係中學以前讀嘅LS咁 不過係純大灣區版本

我覺得係真係對大灣區有更深入嘅了解
（我知道有d人覺得點解要對大灣區了解/好憎大陸 但你再憎大陸都冇辦法抹滅人地不斷進步而香港不斷原地踏步嘅事實 你心裡面可能唔願意接受呢個局面 但呢個就係事實 keep住做井底之蛙 唔願意正視目前局面 仲自視過高可能就係其中一個香港目前冇辦法再進步嘅原因之一）
reviews.comment_teaching:
話說我由頭到尾都唔知prof個名點讀
我認為佢教書係80%讀ppt 10%係講講下lag機
10% Extra知識咁
教就的確係一般般架啦 不過佢好認真去解答同學問題 就算我地present得好柒我覺得佢都係幾encouraging
不過最好笑係真係不斷教書講嘢lag機
同埋好悶zzz 我成日上堂上到訓著
後面一半present 一半教書 我就走堂鳥
reviews.comment_grading:
我覺得唔差其實 最後有B 如果認真讀應該可以B+以上

midterm 啱啱好踩mean （冇時間溫 前面連住3個midterm）
group project 冇見到個分（但佢話佢出咗 笑死）
final都冇出分 但自我感覺final做得ok 原因見下

midterm 同 final其實都幾多ppt要睇
我兩次都係考前一日先溫 因為冇時間+唔重視呢個cc
本身已經抱住會爛grade嘅心態黎reg
同埋prof會係ppt加插一啲exam/midterm會出嘅問題
呢個好重要！！！！！
我基本上就係prep咗啲問題就去考 ppt都冇睇完（ppt真係好多）
考試嘅時候 我全部都係做ppt有出現過嘅long question
我就將我prep好咗嘅背翻上去
所以其實prep ppt啲question再screen下ppt就夠做到B range

如果你dse LS唔差 呢科你可以當係專讀LS中國 topic
答問題同讀對你黎講都應該係得心應手

我個人心得：10個有10個都同我講呢個係大伏course 咁我呢個伺服器（試伏器）上完之後覺得其實還好 因為我之前所有讀過嘅cc都係攞c range 呢個係我第一個攞b range嘅cc
我覺得太多人妖魔化呢個course 我呢啲讀書差嘅人都可以唔擺effort就有B 如果肯唔用有色眼鏡睇呢個course 認真讀可能有好嘅outcome
reviews.comment_workload:
以我個人黎講係0 workload

就係有一個group project 非常簡單
揀一個你覺得有興趣嘅大灣區地區做topic 你鐘意做咩都得
然後就整個ppt present
present時間就睇人數 avg1人1分鐘講嘢
可以睇稿 唔睇你present skills
我就其實都hea做 成個project唔計練present
我只係用咗一個鐘搞個ppt

功課好似有比過1份 但好簡單 我15分鐘就做完
基本上可以話冇功課

attendance 係 0 你鐘意嘅話只係出席present都夠

有一個midterm同final （前半係mc 後半係short question）
雖然話係short question得2分 但其實要寫好多去explan清楚
fianl寫到我要加紙

reviews.author: Linda-lynn
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely boring. Sometimes ask a question but never answer it. Explain things with fuzziness, you can't get what he really wanna say. What he ask you in exams is far more harder than what he had taught, even some of them haven't been emphasised by him.
reviews.comment_grading: The A range is lower than 20%. The questions in exams are with fuzziness and need your strong ability of analysing it yourself, rather than remember what he has included in his slides. Many of the questions make people dumb, the answers are strange and can't be easily understood.

reviews.author: wmaae
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly focusing on these topics in GBA:
Megacity regions
Nature, Agriculture and Culture
Economic Dynamism
Governance: one region, many systems
Urbanization, Planning and Sustainability
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is knowledgeable, we can obtain some new perspectives regarding the future development of some areas at GBA comparing to other bay areas worldwide. However, his tone during teaching was down, which made students fall asleep very easily. T
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure about the specific grading scheme, but few people can get an A range I think.
Midterm: Mean: 20.6 High: 31 Low: 9.5
Me: 24.5
Final: Mean: 26.8 High: 39.5 Low: 16
Me: 31
My grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
To get a relatively decent score, students need to devote quite a lot of time in revising and finishing homework given. Sometimes, even if students tried hard in preparing for presentations and assignments, the grade won't come out very well because it would be determined subjectively by the instructor.

3 assignments, 1 group presentation
1 midterm and 1 final with MCs and short-answer questions

reviews.author: zyss
reviews.comment_content: external economics, governance and urbanization of GBA
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sometimes confused, but suddenly understand what the professor was talking about after the review.
The professor is very nice, and always friendly to communicate and help with what you are confused about.
reviews.comment_grading:
final doesn't come out
pre B+
mid term: 34.5/40
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one presentation to prepare.
But the workload when preparing the mid term and final term is really high, because you need to skim the textbook and the whole slides. Each chapter of the units consists of over 30 pages and the slides are around one hundred pages...

reviews.author: Dorching
reviews.title: course with low workload
reviews.comment_content: All about the history and current development of GBA.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Powerpoint slides are messy and you wont be able to understand the content if you skip the class.

Professor is very knowledgeable and passionate with the area he studied.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fine but the exams are poorly worded.

75%    Exams: 40% Midterm; 35% Final (2nd half topics, conceptually cumulative)

15 %   Presentation

10 %   Class attendance, games, participation, quizzes/PRS
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload just 1 midterm1 final and short presentation.

Some readings provided but not neccessary to read. Yet I think the readings help a lot in exams as it basically explains all the stuff.

reviews.author: jnjaem0825
reviews.title: Not that bad
reviews.comment_content: Too lazy to post, please refer to others. I guess there is no change. All about GBA, e.g. culture, society, government, regional connectivity...etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring and monotonous tone, made me feel asleep many times. I started skipping classes after midterm.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 31.5/40, mean 26
Final: undisclosed/35 (I guess I didn't perform well in final cuz I started reviewing the day before exam)
Presentation total 15% (only told our group got around B+ in the feedback, no specific score)
Assignment & participation: undisclosed/10. Didn't take attendance and record participation, actually no need to speak in class and can skip lectures.

One assignment on GBA travel plan after midterm, as long as you submit it you get the score I guess.

Exam format: 20~25 multiple choice + 4~7 short answers

One tip for revising exam is finding all answers to those slides titled midterm exam questions or final exam questions. Sometimes prof will provide ans in exam review session. Almost half of short answer questions are mentioned in lecture ppts. Easy to get points

Final grade: B+. I would say not that bad cuz I didn't really put efforts in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light. 1 group presentation on GBA topic, 1 midterm 1 final, non-cumulative. Go through slides before exam will be fine, even though slides are not well-organized and hard to find important points.

Reading material optional, didn't even open it during the semester.

reviews.author: 存齋
reviews.title: knowledgeable professor
reviews.comment_content:
The content is a bit hard for beginners. In general, the course introduces each aspect of the Greater Bay area in detail.
Let me put professor's introduction here.
This course is designed primarily to familiarize you with the GBA not only because understanding its development is important to the people that live in Hong Kong and the GBA region, but also because the region has a big impact on the world and is a model for other mega-city regions.  To understand what makes this large and diverse region so successful, we reduce the complexity challenge by examining the region through the agglomeration processes of external economies, governance and urbanization.  These processes led the GBA’s development and will determine its future—in terms of continued economic development and more importantly in terms of the wellbeing of the GBA’s people.  We will examine how the GBA can function as a cohesive region, but also how the actions of the cities and the diversity of activities within the cities add vibrancy.  We will also put the GBA’s development in perspective, reflecting on the regional culture of the past and what other megacity regions tell us the GBA can be.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think the professor is professional and knowledgeable, excellent English accent because the professor is from Canada. He is really a nice person and always willing to help.In my opinion, he can easily explain a complicated question,and make you laugh at the same time.However, it is a bit boring for people who don't like economy or politics or geography,history.
And each part of the course is quite long and tanglesome. So figure out in advance if you're a good fit for this class. I think you can really learn a lot from this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A-,I only attended the final exam because I was ill during the midterm period. I think the final paper is quite easy because professor  have provided a few titles in his past lecture popwerpoints.

It is a closed-book exam with 24 multiple choices and 8 short answer questions.
For the 24 Multiple Choices
1 mark each
And for the 8 Short Answers
2 marks each
4 compulsory (governance, people, land
markets, disparity)
4 choice out of 7
4 mark option for regional mobility
reviews.comment_workload:
one presentation and one graph assignment, the presentation is quite relevant to the course. You just need to introduce your favorite part in GBA, like education or transportation. The topic is unlimited.
The objective of this project is for you to explore the GBA through a topic of your interest and to broaden the class’s understanding of the GBA through your project.  
The topic can be an issue, a place, a relationship between places, a group of people,
occupations, a type of company or industry, activities such as sport or dance, entertainment
types and venues, food, nightlife areas, a real or virtual journey, whatever.
Explain what it is, its characteristics, and why it is that way.

reviews.author: kkbb
reviews.title: light workload
reviews.comment_content:
*online semester*
Different topics about GBA:
Natural and Cultural Conditions (Lingnan Culture)
Economy/External Economies (Local Clusters and Regional Coordination, Spatial Interaction, Regional Innovation System, HK's role)
Governance (Multi-level and Regional Governance)
Urbanization (Rural Transformation and Migration,  Land market, Planning, Housing, Social Disparity and Equity)
reviews.comment_teaching: The class is informative and we can know more about different things in GBA. The professor sometimes ask us some questions and he is willing to answer our questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
75%    Exams: 35% Midterm; 40% Final (2nd half topics, conceptually cumulative)

15 %   Presentation

10 %   Class attendance, games, participation, quizzes/PRS
----------------------------------------------------
Open-book exams (Zoom Proctored) (only allowed to view the digital lecture notes via Canvas or in PDF format)
Midterm: 20 MCQs + 5 out of 7 Short Answer Qs + 2 Compulsory Short Answer Qs (MC quiz 25 mins + SAQ quiz 55 mins)
Final: 24 MCQs + 4 out of 8 Choice Answer Qs + 4 Compulsory Short Answer Qs (MC quiz 40 mins + 5 mins break + C&SAQ quiz 1 hr 15 mins)
----------------------------------------------
Not so sure about the 10% thing but I don't think it take attendance every lessons.
---------------------------------------------
Do not know it is good grade or not since final exam result wasn't released.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light. There are some readings but they are not compulsory.

For the presentation, we need to explain some part of the GBA or some issue about the GBA (using a video, Google Earth Tour Builder or some other form). 1-3 people. Five minutes maximum for 1-2 people, each additional person gets one more minute.

reviews.author: n.a.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring. The ppt is messy and not organised. There is too much information and you may not find out the main points easily.

Electronic devices are not allowed in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not really good. I got high in the midterm (above >1 sd) and slightly above mean in the final, ended up with B+.
The exams consist of 20-25 MC and about 5 short questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Only need to do some in-class exercise which is related to the short questions in the exams and a mini presentation (5-7 mins per group).

UReply is used randomly during the semester.

reviews.author: Tracey
reviews.comment_content: As an exchange student, the content was exciting to hear about HK and China's systems. The one class in that I Iearned more than I did in my other classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Disorganized lecture notes. Power points has too many figures which makes it hard to analyze and understand the concepts. Better off reading the textbook. Professor is knowledgeable and try to be unbiased in the lectures. Answers students' questions adequately.
reviews.comment_grading: Not too bad. Got a B+. Feedback is provided for the group project. No feedback on midterm exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Easy workload. 1 group project + presentation. 1 final exam. 1 midterm exam.

reviews.author: Jas
reviews.title: Decent Common Core
reviews.comment_content: The content was interesting and quite thorough on aspects of the greater bay area, looking into culture, environment, history etc. Powerpoints were rather long and vaguely written so you will have to rely upon a basic understanding in class. Lessons are 1 hour 20mins which can be rather long to spend on one powerpoint so I found it rather boring towards the end of class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good. Prof. Patchell explains well and was easy to listen to. He knows a lot about the topic he is teaching and will help answer any questions you may have.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was a struggle. My personal opinion of the exam was that questions were poorly worded. Questions were vague and difficult to understand and I rarely knew what Prof. Patchell was looking for in an answer.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light with a midterm, a final and one short presentation exercise.

There are pre-readings posted on canvas but it is not a must to read them.

reviews.author: Denise Chan
reviews.title: A new course
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge about the Greater Bay Area including economic, political and social aspect.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is great with lots of examples and some case study. The professor will upload the presentation notes on to canvas after the lesson which is very useful for revision.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very lenient. Have mid-term, final, peer-review presentation and participation (in-class activities).
reviews.comment_workload: There are some in-class activities and 1 presentation (5 minutes) per group. The presentation can be anything about GBA so it is very flexible and fun. Very low workload instead.
